Description: DESCRIPTION: Pre loved Ray-Ban 3025 Aviator Mirrored Sunglasses. This is one of the worlds most iconic sunglass designs. The silver lens reinvented the market standard with its unique teardrop shape and top lens technology. Ray-Ban Aviator Sunglasses were designed in 1937 to protect US military fighters against the high altitude glare. Ray-Ban Aviator Mirror combines this iconic model with mirrored lenses, so you not only have extra protection from light transmission, but look totally cool! Excellent pre owned condition with minimal signs of wear. 100% Genuine Made in Italy. Model RB3025 029/30 58-14 AVIATOR Large Metal. Gunmetal colour.Size: 58-14Protection: 100% UVA/UVBGender: Unisex Size lens-bridge: 58 14Bridge: 14 mm Arms: 135 mm REF: Always open to offers, feel free to send a message with an offer on any item. Images form part of description, so please view carefully before you purchase. Please see photos for design and condition. POSTAGE IS GENERALLY AUTO GENERATED, PLEASE ASK FOR QUOTE IF IN DOUBT AS IT OFTEN APPEARS HIGHER THAN IT SHOULD BE. Check out my other listings for lots of treasures. International Buyers please request postage quote prior to bidding, we will try to be as accurate as possible via the Australia Post Website. Please note that insurance will be charged additional for international post. Thank you for looking at this listing. Our knowledge of the items that we sell may not be expert, but we aim to provide an honest description as we see it. Please use the photographs, along with our description, to judge for yourself. "old" or "pre loved", please do not expect that it will be in perfect or new condition. It has had a previous life, so it will have some signs of use/wear/dirt. Cleaning is left to the new owners, it will help you bond with your new piece, Pottery and Porcelain will often have crazing. If you are looking for new items, you are in the wrong place unless stated new. We aim to be as accurate and helpful as possible, and will draw your attention to any significant fault seen, in text and/or the photos.
